CreateUploadDestinationResponse.description: The response schema for the createUploadDestination operation.

Error.description: Error response returned when the request is unsuccessful.

code.description: An error code that identifies the type of error that occurred.

details.description: Additional details that can help the caller understand or fix the issue.

message.description: A message that describes the error condition in a human-readable form.

ErrorList.description: A list of error responses returned when a request is unsuccessful.

headers.description: The headers to include in the upload request.

uploadDestinationId.description: The unique identifier for the upload destination.

url.description: The URL for the upload destination.

info.description: The Selling Partner API for Uploads provides operations that support uploading files.
info.title: Selling Partner API for Uploads

post.description:
Creates an upload destination for a resource that you specify and returns the information required to upload to that destination.

**Usage Plan:**

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| .1 | 5 |

For more information, see "Usage Plans and Rate Limits" in the Selling Partner API documentation.

parameters.description: A list of marketplace identifiers. This specifies the marketplaces where the upload will be available. Only one marketplace can be specified.
parameters.name: marketplaceIds

parameters.description: An MD5 hash of the content to be submitted to the upload destination. This value is used to determine if the data has been corrupted or tampered with during transit.
parameters.name: contentMD5

parameters.description: The URL of the resource for the upload destination that you are creating. For example, to create an upload destination for a Buyer-Seller Messaging message, the {resource} would be /messaging and the path would be  /uploads/v1/uploadDestinations/messaging
parameters.name: resource

parameters.description: The content type of the file to be uploaded.
parameters.name: contentType

400.description: Request has missing or invalid parameters and cannot be parsed.

403.description: Indicates that access to the resource is forbidden. Possible reasons include Access Denied, Unauthorized, Expired Token, or Invalid Signature.

404.description: The resource specified does not exist.

413.description: The request size exceeded the maximum accepted size.

415.description: The request payload is in an unsupported format.

429.description: The frequency of requests was greater than allowed.

500.description: An unexpected condition occurred that prevented the server from fulfilling the request.

503.description: Temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.
